title: Iration Steppas
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/iration.jpg)](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/iration.jpg)

Dub and ‘sound system’ culture has had an influence on music such as early Ragga Jungle through to Drum and Bass for a significant period. Moving across the millennium its injection into genres like dubstep and breaks has once again taken music in a brave new direction. However despite its lengthy history, one of the last remaining British touring systems is the Leeds based **IRATION STEPPAS SOUNDSYSTEM**.

On the second of May they blessed Newcastle’s **Deviate** with their mix of roots reggae and high pressured dub. **Iration Steppas** create a brand of dub which seems like it was made for the sole purpose of being played over their own system; with methodical melodies accompanied by warm but bone shattering bass lines underneath.

With **Iration** was **Punch Drunk’s RSD**, their music epitomising the more ‘dub influenced’ side of dubstep. Coming on at about 1 after Iration Steppas had steadily warmed the packed crowd; **RSD** smashed it. Pushing the tempo up and dropping **Congo Natty’s** _‘Code Red’_, a particularly special moment given how rare Jungle seems to be in Newcastle. **Iration** finished off the night in style, eventually setting fire to one of their right bass bins! It was certainly a night no one will forget.

Written by Jack Tomson
